What is the gender balance in those, creative, industries? Where is the push for students to get involved in those? Some of these require both a creative and a STEM frame of mind. Where is the push for that combination? Time for some perspective.
Over the last 20 years this area has grown and grown. Gaming, Comics, TV (indigenous and foreign companies) Film (as above) I'm sure that there are others that my narrow experience isn't aware of.

I'm not one of the teachers that has a problem with the pushing of STEM in schools (I do have a problem with the over reliance on industry for advice here) but I do wonder where the push for the arts is.

@ronandusty I think so. Actually I'm going to say yes, yes it will. If you've seen S1 of Daredevil then you should be fine.
@ronandusty Forget all of them and just stick with Daredevil. Jessica Jones S2 was awful. Tedious and drawn out with little to say. Luke Cage S2 was good but this is far better.

@ronandusty Yep. Half way through and I think it's the best season of all the shows. Gritty, visceral fight scenes. No dancing and spinning. All hard punches and fumbling for the advantage. And unashamedly allegorical.

I'm enjoying The Doctor, but not the stories. Very linear, a+b+c=d. Nothing different, nothing quirky, nothing where you'd say 'how the hell did they think of that'. And the pacing seems off. Very slow, without the usual punchy dialogue. Love the main characters and the look.

@KMUBarry @gregfoley2002 Don't know about the definition of 'illness' with respect to the LC (does seem a stretch) but an exam that seems to cause some kind of national PTSD does need to be changed. (obviously not real PTSD but having nightmares about an exam decades later seems odd)

@KMUBarry @gregfoley2002 Just because it's been around for a long time doesn't mean that it doesn't cause 'mental illness' now. Maybe it always did. I want to see some change to the points system but not at the loss of the equalising effect.
